summary: This is a Law360 news article reporting that a Manhattan federal judge indicated a Texas woman's sexual battery lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell is likely to proceed, as the claims against her appear plausible. The article references allegations against both Maxwell and the deceased Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier who, along with Ghislaine Maxwell, is alleged to have subjected a Texas woman to sexual battery.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Former girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein, British socialite, defendant
persons.context: Former girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein and co-defendant in a sexual battery lawsuit filed by a Texas woman. A judge indicated the claims against her are likely plausible.

connections.description: Described as former girlfriend and co-accused in subjecting a Texas woman to sexual battery.
Maxwell is the defendant in a sexual battery lawsuit filed by the unnamed Texas woman.
Epstein is alleged to have subjected the Texas woman to sexual battery alongside Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Judge's indication on battery suit
events.description: A Manhattan federal judge indicated that a Texas woman's sexual battery lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell likely has plausible claims and is not likely to be dismissed.

keyFacts: A Manhattan federal judge indicated a Texas woman's sexual battery lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell is likely to proceed.
The lawsuit alleges both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell subjected the woman to sexual battery.
The judge found the claims against Maxwell to be plausible.
The article is dated April 17, 2020, referencing a judicial statement from the previous day (Thursday, April 16, 2020).
The plaintiff is identified only as a 'Texas woman'; her name is not provided in this excerpt.
